'Technical Discovery with Customer'}]}, {'type': 'paragraph', 'content': [{'type': 'text', 'text': 'The core problem is a security conflict between Nordea's network and BrowserStack's SDKs.

Nordea's network uses SSL interception, a process where it decrypts all outgoing traffic to inspect it for security threats. To do this, it replaces the original website's (BrowserStack's) SSL certificate with its own, Nordea-issued certificate.

BrowserStack's SDKs, by design, expect to see BrowserStack's official SSL certificate. When they see Nordea's certificate instead, they detect a mismatch and, for security reasons, terminate the connection with an SSL_CERT_VERIFY_FAILED error. This is a standard security feature to prevent man-in-the-middle attacks. 🛡️

How 'disable-ssl-validation' can solve It
Adding a disable-ssl-validation flag to BrowserStack's SDKs would directly address this issue by telling the client to skip the certificate verification step.

When this flag is enabled, the SDK would no longer check if the certificate it receives is the authentic one from BrowserStack. Instead, it would simply accept the certificate provided by Nordea's network and establish the connection.

Essentially, it's an instruction to the SDK that says: "I know the certificate is not the one you expect, but please trust it and connect anyway." This bypasses the security check that is currently causing the connection to fail, allowing traffic to flow between Nordea's network and BrowserStack.'}]}, {'type': 'heading', 'attrs': {'level': 3}, 'content': [{'type': 'text', 'text': 'Description'}]}, {'type': 'paragraph', 'content': [{'type': 'text', 'text': "Issue details / Slack thread of the discovery done with Product - https://browserstack.slack.com/archives/C05ALJK2YSH/p1727366854501619
